title: Day 89 – Rest Day in Cedar City, UT
content:
Raisin Bran for breakfast! I miss cereal. Tess and I did some grocery shopping in the morning, and then walked around exploring the town for a bit. It’s the home of Southern Utah University, so it has some cool stuff going on - shops, restaurants, cafés, the works. Tess unsuccessfully tried to locate a new pair of Keens. We met Pat and Ken at Mandarin, and Tess finally got her Chinese food fix. Moo shu veggie pancakes and a very poignant fortune (apparently borrowed from Marie Curie).

After lunch our hosts took us to see the Cedar City Utah Temple, the regional LDS temple. It’s only 5 years old and impressive looking. It was very busy for a Wednesday afternoon, with fancily-dressed Mormons going in and out in droves.

Afterwards Tess and I hung out at the coffee shop for a while and caught up on posts and phone calls. At their request, we took Pat and Ken to Teriyaki Grill for dinner (they insisted on getting our lunch but relented on us getting them dinner).

After getting our laundry and packing done we watched Invictus, and fell asleep brimming with pride for that ragtag ‘95 Springboks team.
